description:
probably a permissions issue or something, but the first time you open it it tells you that the the profile is missing.

Sorry, but I'm past the days of the 00's when you had to fiddle with basic apps to get them to work. A browser should be able to do its thing immediately out of the box.

Worked fine until update 13.5, it says "Profile Missing: Your MullvadBrowser profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible." -----NEEDS FIX!! Worked awesome until last update!!
3 Stars Now, 5 Stars When Working!!
summary: Not Working Version: 13.5 After Update! Need FIX!!

description:
The latest version as of writing this review (version 13.5) can't be opened. There is an error of "Your MullvadBrowser profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible.".

Previous versions worked flawlessly.
This is NOT the official Mullvad browser, and is not supported by the Mullvad devs, as stated repeatedly on their github. Also, this flatpak doesn't even load, giving a profile error.
Very good however 13.5 update reverted my profile making me loose bookmarks, extensions, configurations, ect.

I don't know if it is a feature or issue which i am facing. For resisting fingerprinting some measures are taken like identifying as it runs on windows NT, differnt screen resolution, etc.. but it also make timezone 0:00 utc which think makes issues in otp verificatio(since it is time based) :(

I just tried Multivad because I was annoyed at the default behavior of the browser I had been using. Just got it (Fedora 39 here) and on my first hour with it, doing some routine stuff, it behaved *flawlessly* and I did not have a single burp or bothersome quirk. Multivad may become my default browser very soon--I'm amazed at how easily everything went. (I keep telling my wife if she'd switch from WinXi to Fedora, she'd be dazzled and never switch back; that sort of reaction. Sorry, this is too long. :-/
Thanks for being fast, but setting mullvad browser as default web app does not work and also touch screen scroll does not work
summary: Great but needs to be recompiled

description: Excellent work! A privacy browser for clearnet from one of the best vpn providers on the planet! I user the tor-browser for anonymity and privacy but it doesn't work for everything so this is a great addition to my online privacy tools. Thanks Mullvad!
nice fast alternative to tor. Great to see mullvad going beyond to help protect privacy .
Amazing browser
Fast and no nonsens browser

Pretty much a hardened version of firefox which means you do not have to adjust a bunch of settings in order to get a secure and private browsing experience. Mullvad is ready to use out of the box, and should in fact not be tweaked at this will leave you more vulnerable to fingerprinting. It comes with an addblocker as well as Mullvad's own addon that is handy when using the browser with Mullvad VPN.
Now that .desktop files have been disabled in SteamOS 3.5 in the name of security I'm forced to use flatpaks. History repeats itself: users are treated as imbeciles
I don't know if you guys understand what kind of power this browser really has.
This one looks like something I could have made in the 90s.
It does what it was designed to do.

Basically, it is tor browser without the tor network which one can argue is the best balance between staying safe from the tracking out there and not going off the grid for maintaing privacy and anonymity.
summary: Excellent browser for security and privacy enthusiasts!

description: This is my browser when I just want to look and not worry. It is much more responsive than TOR and the VPN combo allows for great secure searches through "Leta,' further improving privacy. Even better, it is not chromium based. Love it!

Au top niveau protection des données, assez similaire à Tor browser mais en étant Open-source ! Seulement il est assez lent mais bon comme protection des données et vitesse ne va pas ensemble (on le voit avec Chrome qui est l'exacte opposé de ce naviguateur) et bien je lui met 5/5 ! Bravo !
summary: Le meilleur si la vitesse de naviguation n'est pas un problème
